Interface_name: HTTP client using cURL in PHP
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using cURL, supporting various HTTP methods, streaming, authentication, and proxy configuration.

Class Description: The RequestCore class provides a comprehensive HTTP client implementation using PHP's cURL extension. It supports standard HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD), handles request/response processing, streaming uploads/downloads, authentication, proxy configuration, and SSL verification.

Attributes:

request_url: string - The URL to send the request to
request_headers: array - Associative array of request headers
request_body: string - The request body content
response: string - The complete response including headers and body
response_headers: array - Parsed response headers
response_body: string - The response body content
response_code: int - HTTP response status code
response_info: array - Additional cURL response information
curl_handle: resource - The cURL handle resource
method: string - HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD)
proxy: array|null - Proxy configuration details
username: string|null - Username for authentication
password: string|null - Password for authentication
curlopts: array|null - Additional cURL options
debug_mode: bool - Whether to enable debug mode
request_class: string - Class name for request handling
response_class: string - Class name for response handling
useragent: string - User-Agent header value
read_file: string|null - File path for streaming read
read_stream: resource|null - Stream resource for reading
read_stream_size: int|null - Size of read stream
read_stream_read: int - Bytes read from stream
write_file: string|null - File path for streaming write
write_stream: resource|null - Stream resource for writing
seek_position: int|null - Position to seek in read stream
cacert_location: mixed - CA certificate location
ssl_verification: bool - Whether to verify SSL
registered_streaming_read_callback: callable|null - Callback for streaming read
registered_streaming_write_callback: callable|null - Callback for streaming write
timeout: int - Request timeout in seconds
connect_timeout: int - Connection timeout in seconds

Methods:

__construct(string $url = null, string $proxy = null, array $helpers = null) -> self - Initializes the request with URL and optional proxy/helpers
__destruct() -> self - Cleans up open file handles
set_credentials(string $user, string $pass) -> self - Sets authentication credentials
add_header(string $key, string $value) -> self - Adds a request header
remove_header(string $key) -> self - Removes a request header
set_method(string $method) -> self - Sets the HTTP method
set_useragent(string $ua) -> self - Sets the User-Agent header
set_body(string $body) -> self - Sets the request body
set_request_url(string $url) -> self - Sets the request URL
set_curlopts(array $curlopts) -> self - Sets additional cURL options
set_read_stream_size(int $size) -> self - Sets the read stream size
set_read_stream(resource $resource, int $size = null) -> self - Sets the read stream resource
set_read_file(string $location) -> self - Sets a file for streaming read
set_write_stream(resource $resource) -> self - Sets the write stream resource
set_write_file(string $location) -> self - Sets a file for streaming write
set_proxy(string $proxy) -> self - Configures proxy settings
set_seek_position(int $position) -> self - Sets the seek position for read stream
register_streaming_read_callback(callable $callback) -> self - Registers streaming read callback
register_streaming_write_callback(callable $callback) -> self - Registers streaming write callback
streaming_read_callback(resource $curl_handle, resource $file_handle, int $length) -> string - Callback for streaming read
streaming_write_callback(resource $curl_handle, string $data) -> int - Callback for streaming write
prep_request() -> resource - Prepares and returns a cURL handle
process_response(resource $curl_handle = null, string $response = null) -> mixed - Processes the cURL response
send_request(bool $parse = false) -> mixed - Sends the request and returns response
send_multi_request(array $handles, array $opt = null) -> array - Sends multiple requests in parallel
